task_summary: Pick the cube from the shelf: perceive, approach, grasp, and retreat with the object.

task_long_description.overview: This task requires a robotic arm to pick up a white cube located within the lower right cell of a shelf. The robot must first perceive and localize the cube, open the gripper, approach and align above the object, compute and execute a top grasp, verify the object is secured, and finally retreat after grasping. The scene is in a kitchen, and the cube is the only object targeted for manipulation.
stepwise_plan: Visually search for and detect the cube
Move above and align with the cube
success_criteria: Cube is securely grasped by the gripper
Robot arm retracts with cube in grasp
failure_and_recovery: Collision or obstruction: abort and wait
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after the cube is successfully grasped and retracted from the shelf.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Scans the shelf area for the cube using a grid pattern; repeated if initial detection fails.
Detects and localizes the cube for manipulation.
Opens gripper to accept the cube, using a medium opening.
Moves the gripper above the cube by 5cm for pregrasp alignment.
Computes the grasp pose on the cube using a top strategy and stores it.
Precise approach to the cube with 0.005m tolerance.
Executes the grasp at the computed pose using the top strategy.
Checks whether the cube is held in the gripper.
Retracts the arm by 10cm after successful grasp.

failure_modes: Cube not found due to occlusion or misposition
Grasp unsuccessful due to inaccurate pose or insufficient opening
Object slips from gripper on retreat
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning and detection up to three times
Repeat approach or adjust gripper width if grasp fails
Abort and signal operator if repeated failures
assumptions: Instruction 'pick the cube' matches visual evidence: a white cube in shelf is present and targeted in all frames.
Cube is accessible in shelf cell; no additional placement or transfer is required per image sequence.

expected_success_criteria: Gripper closes on the cube and lifts
